I thought so too, as I found that post when Googling this issue, however, I note that issue was reported over a year ago, with CuDNN 7.1.0.2, and CuDNN is now on 7.4.x, and Nvidia claims to have solved this issue with driver 390+, which is the driver I have on my box, so am surprised that this is still an issue. I also note that I don't see this issue with Keras when using its CuDNNLSTM layer for big fits on the same box. I will add code to my script today which disables CuDNN and see if I still get the memory leak. May I please ask if the code I posted has any red flags in it which could be causing this? I would very much appreciate knowing that this is not being caused by something in my code so I can stop looking there for a potential fix.

I thought so too, as I found that post when Googling this issue, however, I
note that issue was reported over a year ago, with CuDNN 7.1.0.2, and CuDNN
is now on 7.4.x, and Nvidia claims to have solved this issue with driver
390+, which is the driver I have on my box, so am surprised that this is
still an issue. I also note that I don't see this issue with Keras when
using its CuDNNLSTM layer for big fits on the same box.

I will add code to my script today which disables CuDNN and see if I still
get the memory leak.

May I please ask if the code I posted has any red flags in it which could
be causing this? I would very much appreciate knowing that this is not
being caused by something in my code so I can stop looking there for a
potential fix.
